column5: 14 hrs cliff lake.
Thanks for the LOL PjShorthorn
Only three and a half months till I'm floating on the lodge on the great Lac Seul.
Haha.
Let's us know how your trip goes. Saw temps in VBay were spring like today at 40+ F PjShorthorn
Ill let you know tonight.has been mild.

Day went great.drove truck out and used it as a wind break.had 25 km winds .fished ti around 1 pm.we got a couple of eaters each and let a bunch go.had another big one on for a few seconds and lost it.lol.did good in 35'-60'.just had to go from hole to hole.basically caught fis in every hole.tubes worked good early but switched to a jig with a small spinnervon it and hat seemed to get them going.
87 days for Obabikon at LOTW. Looking forward to catching a lot of fish and using a guide for a day to land a big musky. Sent from my SM-G935V using Tapatalk
Countdown for me begins on the ride home. Bill
304 days, 21 hours, 5 minutes and 20 seconds until the NARDA Group leaves for our 29th year at Birch Dale Lodge on Eagle Lake!!!!
Now only 7 moons to return to Lac Hebert
Just sent my deposit to Air Mont Laurier. Lac du male here we come in 2017.

One week up on Lac Seul, first week of July and two weeks up on Dinorwic Lake, last week of July first week of August. I now have an RV parked at Dinorwic Lake, so affordability is at an all time high
222 days until we leave for Miniss Lake with Slate Falls Outposts
236 23 hours 44 minutes to check in
Roughly 100 days until the spring run on a Lake Michigan tributary which is 1/4 mile from my house.

Late May, Larus Lake, Nestor Falls Fly-In Outposts.Late June, Clear Lake, Nestor Falls.Would love to hear from anyone who fished Larus Lake last year. I missed that trip for the first time in over 15 years, and can't wait to get back this year. If anybody has fished Herod, Mallette, or Malaher with Nestor Falls, would love to hear from you.
That sounds like a loooong time.narda.

Hard to believe but we only have 103 days before our trip to Lac Hebert. We have 9 guys from the Cleveland and Rochester, NY area. 12 hours to Clova, Quebec and then a 45 float plane to the LAC for 7 days. Doug
Nine moons to return to Hebert
I bought a big supply to last me until I die. I can be persuaded to part with a bottle or two.
I'm not in the market for any right now. I have enough women hanging all over me without using Old Spice PjShorthorn.
Heading to Pringle Lake with MLO for the first time July 24th-29th. Very excited! As highly as they have been discussed, I am anxious to go there and experience it with my two young boys.
This thread needs a bump. 204 days and counting.
40 weeks to Miniss Lake

Great Lake! Who is your outfitter? I flew in with Hidden Bay Lodge! Great people, loved the meal plan, and outstanding fishing! We were there the first week of September last year. Good luck and have a great trip!
We'll be flying in with Slate Falls and staying at the east camp. Our 1st time with Slate Falls. Really looking forward to it especially after seeing Mike Borger's report.

May 2017 will be my 33rd consecutive walleye opener on the same water. I usually go in at least 2 days prior and often fish the entire week before opening day. While pike fishing I've had walleyes hit JSM and suicks.Fishing during a time of great change is usually exciting.Follow the walleyes as they leave spawning area. That's what pike do. BIG PIKE.
294. Not getting too excited yet.
349 and counting
10 moons to return to Lac Hebert with air Tamarac

After seeing some pictures and videos from Mike Borger's recent trip to Miniss Lake I had to bump this thread back to the top. 313 days until we leave for Miniss Lake with Slate Falls Outposts. It's going to be a long *** winter!

You know what Bear? I have to drive 1100 miles to get to Northwest Ontario's "Land of the fishing Giants." I just decided if I have to drive that far , I am going to stay 2 weeks. If just isn't logical to stay a week when anybody with half a brain knows you are going to get rained out 1-3 days.
My son and I only travel around 900 miles,...and for 2017 we decided to stay for 2 weeks also! 1 week just isn't enough for us!!
The waiting game !!
13 days for me, would be 6 but I have to go visit my kids next weekend for our Thanksgiving.

Every time I read this thread I'm grateful I live in northern MN where traveling 150 miles north to lakes near the border can be done for a three-day weekend. We can leave at 7 am and be fishing on Lac Suel in the afternoon. We have some very good local lakes too. I have a trip coming up next week to the Canadian side of Rainy Lake and then look forward for ice in January for some lake trout fishing.
227 days to Wine Lake. Its gonna be a long winter. Fortunately, I am still on the high from our fall trip through Mattice to Luella Lake. However, it is fading fast.... Fish On! Hooks
236 and 267 days, respectively, for trip 1 and trip 2 to Lac Seul!!
347 days till I'm back on Perrault Lake/Cedar Lake at Perrault Lake Camp,...I'll be back sooner if I find a pot of gold,....so I guess I better go start digging !!!!Chuck
Boy oh boy... Are you gonna make "Wallydave" unhappy with you for starting his annual countdown thread six months before he does! Poor Dave... :-)Pooch
Gary, no problem! I enjoy his enthusiasm! I usually start in January. It's all good!
This is almost as bad as the fact that there is no more Old Spice aftershave available. Things are getting " a little out of kilter" here on WC ....... PjShorthorn.

I was going to start one in October after this season wrapped up but since Bear started it.....1 year and one month or 396 days until we leave for Miniss Lake with Slate Falls Outposts. And thank God they don't make Old Spice aftershave anymore!

A group of eight flying into International Falls from Denver, CO Aug 18. Quick drive to Red Lake, stay the night and a short flight using Chimo Air to Donald Lake in the Woodland Caribou Park for 7 days. Private Camp, year 9!
Just refreshing the thread. 370 days until we leave for Miniss Lake with Slate Falls Outposts.
As for Canada, we'll be on Rainy in about 340 days. As for my first fly-in, it's a long, LONG T-minus 730 days or thereabouts. Will have to wait for the 2018 countdown for that one.
322 days to our first trip to Blackbirch Lake thru Attawapiskat River Adventures. It's going to be a long winter waiting for this trip!!
307 days until Nungesser with NLL. First trip for the boy, looking forward to a great time. First time going in June so it will be interesting.
